definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: burn, be kindled, of anger (Aram. [[חרי]] Pa. cause, fire to burn (rare); Zinj. [[חרא]] anger, Nö:ZMG 1893, 98. 103; Ar. h.arwah;un burning sensation, in throat, etc., fr. rage and pain)—

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: impers., [[אף]] omitted; [[חרה לְ]] it was kindled for (him) he burned with anger Ge 31:36 (E), Ge 4:5, Ge 4:6, Ge 34:7, Nu 16:15 (J), 1Sa 15:11 (rd. perh. [[וַיֵּחֶר]], Weir in Dr), 1Sa 18:8, 1Sa 20:7, 1Sa 20:7, 2Sa 3:8, 2Sa 6:8 = 1Ch 13:11, 2Sa 13:21, 2Sa 19:43, Ne 3:33, Ne 4:1, Ne 5:6, Jon 4:1, Jon 4:4, Jon 4:9, Jon 4:9; ins. [[ויחר לדוד]] 2Sa 11:22 LXX We Dr; [[בְּעֵינֵי]] ´[[ח]] Ge 31:35, Ge 45:5 (E).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: [[חרה לְ]] Ge 18:30, Ge 18:32 (J) 2Sa 22:8 = Ps 18:8.—Note: [[חרה]] not in HP (who use [[קחף]]); nor in Je Ez Is:Is 2 Pr or poetry of Jb.

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. [[נִחֲרוּ־]] sq. [[בְּ]] Ct So 1:6 (acc. to Bö:ii. 379 De Kö:1. 551) be angry with; Pt. ´[[כּׂל הַנֶּחֱרִים בְּ]] all that are incensed against (thee) Is 41:11, so Is 45:24.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. [[הֶחֱרָה הֶחֱזִיק]] Ne 3:20 burned with zeal (?) in repairing, but LXX om. [[החרה]]; prob. dittogr.; Impf. [[וַיַּחַר עָלַי אַפּוֹ]] Job 19:11 and kindled his anger against me.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. [[אַל תִּתְחַר]] Ps 37:1, Ps 37:7, Ps 37:8, Pr 24:19 heat oneself in vexation.—The foll. forms are somewhat dub.: Impf. 2 ms. [[אֵיח]] [[תְּתַחֲרֶה אֶת־הַסּוּסִים]] Je 12:5 how canst thou hotly contend (in a race) with the horses ? Pt. [[כִּי]] [[אַתָּה מְתַחֲרֶה בָאָָרֶז]] Je 22:15 because thou strivest eagerly (to excel) in cedar; expl. as Tiph‘ēl by Thes Ges:§ 55, 5 Ew:§ 122 a Ol:§ 255 a Sta:§ 159 b Kö:i. p. 557 al., and regarded by most as a rare causative stem; but ag. existence of Tiph‘ēl v. Ba:NB § 180 a; ZMG 1894, 20; Ba regards the form as denom. (fr. a noun formed by [[ת]] preform., cf. Aram. tah.ruwto0 contention); SS would point as Hithp. [cf. Syr. 0eth.ariy contend with, h.eryo0 contention], although meaning of Hithp. is diff., v. supr.
